    <div class="block-article-content__spacing">
        <div class="article-body">
            <div>
                
                <div id="po-inline-article-above"></div>
                <div id="po-inline-articlewall-fullarticle-closable"></div>
                <div id="po-inline-articlegate-fullarticle"><div id="subscription-above-article"></div><div id="subscription-replace-entire-article"><p class="article-first-paragraph">Rebuilding the NHS is the “cornerstone” of rebuilding Britain, the Prime Minister said, as he pledged to fight for it “day and night”.</p>
<div id="inArticleAd" class="advert-container mar-block-ad mar-block-ad--in-article"><div id="DFP_in_article_mpu"></div></div>
<div id="po-inline-articlewall-partialarticle-closable"></div>
<div id="po-inline-articlegate-partialarticle">
<div id="po-overlay-articlegate-full-width-scroll-below"></div>
<div id="subscription-content">
<p>Sir Keir Starmer unveiled more detail about his plans for tackling NHS waiting lists, with the aim of slashing the number of people waiting longer than 18 weeks for NHS treatment in England by nearly half a million over the next year.</p>
<p>He said he will also expand the use of the private sector, acknowledging that some will “not like this” but saying he is “not interested in putting ideology before patients”.</p>
<div id="inArticleAd-1" data-name-place="DFP_outbrain">
    <aside><div class="OUTBRAIN" data-ob-contenturl="https://www.dumbartonreporter.co.uk/news/national/24835544.starmer-promises-reform-nhs-fight-day-night/" data-ob-installation-key="NEWSQ15BEE3GLF6A6AL9EECN9" data-widget-id="AR_2"></div></aside><script>
        if (whiteList === true) {
            $('#inArticleAd-1').remove();
        }
    </script>
</div>
<!-- EMBED START Image --><figure id="embedded278627732"><img src="//image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/9441967c7bff95d4fba22e693323bdecY29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3MDE2/2.78627732.jpg?w=640" alt="Sir Keir Starmer visit to Surrey" data-title="Sir Keir Starmer visit to Surrey" data-copyright-holder="PA Wire" data-copyright-notice="PA Wire/PA Images" data-credit="Leon Neal" data-usage-terms="" srcset="https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/9441967c7bff95d4fba22e693323bdecY29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3MDE2/2.78627732.jpg?w=320 320w, https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/9441967c7bff95d4fba22e693323bdecY29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3MDE2/2.78627732.jpg?w=640 640w, https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/9441967c7bff95d4fba22e693323bdecY29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3MDE2/2.78627732.jpg?w=1280 1280w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 89vw, (max-width: 1000px) 54vw, (max-width: 1071px) 543px, 580px"><figcaption>Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer delivers a speech on his plans for the NHS during a visit to the Elective Orthopaedic Centre in Epsom, Surrey (Leon Neal/PA)</figcaption></figure><!-- EMBED END Image --><p>During a speech in Surrey, the Prime Minister said 2025 “is about rebuilding Britain and rebuilding our NHS is the cornerstone of that”.</p>
<p>He added: “We will, of course, protect the principles we all cherish – that you will work to every day – care free at the point of use, treatment according to need, key principles.</p>
<div id="inArticleAd-2" class="advert-container mar-block-ad mar-block-ad--in-article"><div id="DFP_in_article_2"></div></div>
<p>“But to catapult the service into the future, we need an NHS that is reformed from top to bottom, millions of extra appointments signed, sealed and delivered with the plan that we are launching here today.</p>
<p>“National renewal in action.”</p>
<p>Sir Keir said the NHS must be “hungry for innovation” but reiterated his belief that the health service cannot become a “national money pit”.</p>
<div id="piano-container-inside-article" style="display: none; margin-bottom: 20px; clear: both;">
                <div id="po-inline-article-inside" style="display: none; margin-bottom: 20px; clear: both;"></div>
            </div>
<!-- EMBED START PA Quote --><figure>
				 <section class="pa-embed pa-quote">
					<div class="pa-quote-wrapper">
						<blockquote>
							<p>
								I believe in public service. I believe in the NHS. I’ll fight for it day and night
							</p>
						</blockquote>
					</div>
				   <cite><em>Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer</em></cite>
				 </section>
			</figure><!-- EMBED END PA Quote --><p>He said: “Productivity can’t (be) 11% lower than it was before the pandemic.</p>
<p>“Working people can’t be expected to subsidise the current levels of care with ever-rising taxes.</p>
<p>“That is the price of ducking reform, and I won’t stand for it.</p>
<p>“I believe in public service. I believe in the NHS. I’ll fight for it day and night. I’ll never stand for that.”</p>
<p>Under his plans, Sir Keir said the NHS must deliver convenience for patients, just as people can book holidays and find love online.</p>
<div id="inArticleAd-3" class="advert-container mar-block-ad mar-block-ad--in-article"><div id="DFP_in_article_3"></div></div>
<p>“This plan that we’re launching today is a comprehensive level of that mindset, an NHS that treats patients more quickly, that is closer to their lives, gives them the level of convenience that they take for granted in nearly every other service they use every day,” he said.</p>
<p>“Just think about it – every day, just a few swipes of their phone, millions of people buy food or clothes for themselves and their family, they book holidays, they even find love.</p>
<p>“There is no reason, no good reason, why a public, free-at-the-point-of-use NHS can’t deliver that kind of convenience. In fact, it must.”</p>
<!-- EMBED START Image --><figure id="embedded278627424"><img src="//image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/fd461c80b9e199bb85c78b1a3ed36a13Y29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3NTAz/2.78627424.jpg?w=640" alt="Sir Keir Starmer visit to Surrey" data-title="Sir Keir Starmer visit to Surrey" data-copyright-holder="PA Wire" data-copyright-notice="PA Wire/PA Images" data-credit="Leon Neal" data-usage-terms="" srcset="https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/fd461c80b9e199bb85c78b1a3ed36a13Y29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3NTAz/2.78627424.jpg?w=320 320w, https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/fd461c80b9e199bb85c78b1a3ed36a13Y29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3NTAz/2.78627424.jpg?w=640 640w, https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/fd461c80b9e199bb85c78b1a3ed36a13Y29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3NTAz/2.78627424.jpg?w=1280 1280w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 89vw, (max-width: 1000px) 54vw, (max-width: 1071px) 543px, 580px"><figcaption>Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer and Health Secretary Wes Streeting meet members of staff during a visit to the Elective Orthopaedic Centre in Epsom, Surrey (Leon Neal/PA)</figcaption></figure><!-- EMBED END Image --><p>The Prime Minister also pledged “better use” of capacity in the private sector to help cut NHS waiting lists, all free at the point of use to patients.</p>
<p>Under a new deal outlined by the Department of Health, women on gynaecological waiting lists and orthopaedics patients are among those who will be offered quicker treatment via private hospitals.</p>
<p>In gynaecology, there is currently a backlog of 260,000 women waiting more than 18 weeks for treatments, while in orthopaedics more than 40% of patients are waiting longer than the 18-week target.</p>
<p>The Government said the new deal will mean the NHS makes better use of the independent sector to tackle waiting lists “as well as providing millions more appointments”.</p>
<div id="inArticleAd-4" class="advert-container mar-block-ad mar-block-ad--in-article"><div id="DFP_in_article_4"></div></div>
<p>In his speech, the Prime Minister pledged to put patients at the centre of their treatment and shift more care closer to the towns and cities where they live, which he said will make a “massive difference” to waiting times.</p>
<!-- EMBED START PA Quote --><figure>
				 <section class="pa-embed pa-quote">
					<div class="pa-quote-wrapper">
						<blockquote>
							<p>
								There’s no institution more important for the security of our country than the National Health Service
							</p>
						</blockquote>
					</div>
				   <cite><em>Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer </em></cite>
				 </section>
			</figure><!-- EMBED END PA Quote --><p>Meanwhile, allowing GPs to communicate directly with specialists to seek advice and diagnose people more quickly will save more than 800,000 “unnecessary” appointments and referrals every year.</p>
<p>Sir Keir told the medics who gathered to hear him speak that “no institution” is more important to the security of the country than the NHS.</p>
<p>He said: “There’s no institution more important for the security of our country than the National Health Service.</p>
<p>“Built by that generation eight decades ago now, it’s the embodiment of British values and humanities – fairness, equal respect.”</p>
<!-- EMBED START Image --><figure id="embedded278627804"><img src="//image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/ea5ee38f031157edac98f32698931f7dY29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3NjY5/2.78627804.jpg?w=640" alt="Sir Keir Starmer visit to Surrey" data-title="Sir Keir Starmer visit to Surrey" data-copyright-holder="PA Wire" data-copyright-notice="PA Wire/PA Images" data-credit="Leon Neal" data-usage-terms="" srcset="https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/ea5ee38f031157edac98f32698931f7dY29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3NjY5/2.78627804.jpg?w=320 320w, https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/ea5ee38f031157edac98f32698931f7dY29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3NjY5/2.78627804.jpg?w=640 640w, https://image.assets.pressassociation.io/v2/image/production/ea5ee38f031157edac98f32698931f7dY29udGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNzM2MjQ3NjY5/2.78627804.jpg?w=1280 1280w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 89vw, (max-width: 1000px) 54vw, (max-width: 1071px) 543px, 580px"><figcaption>Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer told the medics who gathered to hear him speak that ‘no institution’ is more important to the security of the country than the NHS (Leon Neal/PA)</figcaption></figure><!-- EMBED END Image --><p>The Government has said it will slash waiting times by:</p>
<p>– Creating a bigger network of community diagnostic centres, which provide appointments such as scans, colonoscopies and endoscopies. They will run 12 hours a day, seven days a week. The hope is to deliver up to half a million extra appointments a year.</p>
<p>GPs will be able to refer patients directly to these centres without requiring a prior consultation with a hospital consultant.</p>
<p>– Creating more surgical hubs, as championed by the Royal College of Surgeons. These deliver surgery more quickly in areas such as cataract surgery and orthopaedic operations. These hubs are often separated from other hospital theatres, which means operations in the hubs are not cancelled to make way for emergency surgery.</p>
<p>– Enabling patients to book more tests and scans after work and at weekends, including through the NHS app.</p>

        });

});

// the display code
$.each(adUnits, function(i, data) {

    // check if the dom exists
    if ($('#'+data.domName).length === 0) {
        return;
    }

    if (data.domName === 'DFP_interstitial_mpu') {
        if (!inter.checkVisit()) {
            return;
        }
    }

    // are we manually loading it?
    if ($('#'+data.domName).attr('data-manual-loading') === "yes") {
        return;
    }
    // for mobile, we check if the dom element has the data-delay-loading attribute set to "1"
    else if ($('#'+data.domName).attr('data-delay-loading') === "yes") {

        // load it
        $('#'+data.domName).appear();

function addAdSlot(slotName, slot, initHidden) {
    console.log("Add ad slot called for %s %s", slotName, slot);
    // check if item already exists
    if (typeof window.dfpHolder[slotName] !== 'undefined') {
        return;
    }

    if (window.adLight === true) {
        return;
    }
    window.googletag.cmd.push(function() {
        var dfp = googletag.defineSlot(window.googleId, [[300,250]], slotName)
            .setTargeting('position', [slot])
            .addService(googletag.pubads());
        window.dfpHolder[slotName] = dfp;

        if (!initHidden) {
            googletag.pubads().refresh([dfp]);

            return;
        }
    });
}

                            <h1 class="entry-title single-blog-title">Hungary Reopens Embassy in War-torn Country</h1>                                <div class="single-author">
                                    <span class="author">
                                        <a href="https://hungarytoday.hu/author/admin2/">Hungary Today</a>
                                         2025.01.06.                                </span></div>
                                                    </div>
                        <div class="col-sm-3 single print-buttons">
                            <button id="print-btn-without-picture" class="print-button hide-print" type="button">Print without picture</button>
                                <button id="print-btn-with-picture" class="print-button hide-print" onclick="window.print()">Print with picture</button>
                        </div>
                        <div class="row">
                                                        <div class="col-md-8 single-news-elements " style="border-color:#6b5b95;">
                                <img width="1280" height="854" src="https://hungarytoday.hu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/tank-7556537_1280.jpg" class="attachment-full size-full wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://hungarytoday.hu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/tank-7556537_1280.jpg 1280w, https://hungarytoday.hu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/tank-7556537_1280-300x200.jpg 300w, https://hungarytoday.hu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/tank-7556537_1280-1024x683.jpg 1024w, https://hungarytoday.hu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/tank-7556537_1280-768x512.jpg 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1280px) 100vw, 1280px">
                                <p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Hungary will reopen its embassy in Damascus, the capital of Syria, the Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade announced on his Facebook page on Monday.</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Péter Szijjártó wrote that in recent weeks, much of the world’s attention has been focused on the events in Syria. Now that armed clashes have calmed down and local security conditions have stabilized, “we have decided to reopen Hungary’s Embassy in Damascus,” he announced.</p>
<p><iframe style="border: none; overflow: hidden;" src="https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fszijjarto.peter.official%2Fposts%2Fpfbid0pvEQGfynPvKCYQumXWLKd1XNt8mu8wcKZKJSzUGCyBGTeqbY6y4CZ3YA5aiD6Cq8l&show_text=true&width=500" width="500" height="291" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">According to the minister, the restoration of Hungary’s personal presence on the ground will allow us to receive first-hand, credible information on developments in the country, to represent its political position, and to intervene on behalf of Hungarian citizens when necessary.</p>
<blockquote>
<h3 style="text-align: justify;">Hungary has an interest in peace and stability in the Middle East, and we are also paying particular attention to the Christian communities in the region, for whom we will continue to provide humanitarian assistance.</h3>
</blockquote>
<p style="text-align: justify;">We always speak out strongly in favor of respecting the rights of Christian communities, and this is also the case in Syria,” Szijjártó stressed.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"></p><div class="fact"><h3>Fact</h3> The Syrian civil war is an ongoing multi-sided conflict in Syria involving various state-sponsored and non-state actors. It started in March 2011, when popular discontent with the rule of Bashar al-Assad triggered large-scale protests and pro-democracy rallies across Syria as part of the wider Arab Spring protests in the region. After months of crackdown by the government’s security apparatus, various armed rebel groups such as the Free Syrian Army began forming across the country, marking the beginning of the Syrian insurgency. By mid-2012, the insurgency had escalated into a full-blown civil war.<p></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">After a four-year-long ceasefire between 2020 and 2024, heavy fighting renewed with a major rebel offensive in the northwest led by Tahrir al-Sham and supported by allied groups in the Turkish-backed Syrian National Army in November 2024. By December 8, rebel forces had seized the capital, Damascus. Following this, the Assad regime collapsed, with al-Assad fleeing to Moscow.</p></div><p></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">The Foreign Minister highlighted that the Hungarian ambassador back in Damascus was the first and so far the only Western diplomat to visit the leaders of the two largest Christian denominations, who gave Hungary information on how the Christian communities have experienced the events of the past weeks. Szijjártó recalled that the church leaders thanked Hungary for its strong support for Syrian Christians and for the solidarity that is unfortunately becoming increasingly rare in such uncertain times for European countries.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">As <a href="https://hungarytoday.hu/hungarian-embassy-in-damascus-closed-after-assad-regime-fall/"><em>Hungary Today</em></a> reported earlier, it was announced at the beginning of last December that the Hungarian Embassy in Damascus has been closed due to escalating violence in Syria. To manage consular affairs, the Hungarian Embassy in Beirut had temporarily taken over, providing assistance to Hungarian nationals in the region.</p>
<div class="hide-print embed-article"><div class="related"><span>Related article</span></div><a class="heading" href="https://hungarytoday.hu/?post_type=post&p=306996" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Hungary Provides Humanitarian Aid for Christians in Syria</a><div class="content"><img decoding="async" src="https://hungarytoday.hu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/D_MTI20241202101-scaled.jpg" class="featured-image" alt="Hungary Provides Humanitarian Aid for Christians in Syria"><div class="excerpt"><p>State Secretary Tristan Azbej announced 6 million forints of aid to be allocated to the Syrian Melkite Church.<a class="continue-reading" href="https://hungarytoday.hu/?post_type=post&p=306996" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Continue reading</a></p></div></div></div>
<p><em>Featured photo via Pixabay</em></p>

  function executeParallelAuctionAlongsidePrebid(divid, adcode, adsizes) {
      var FAILSAFE_TIMEOUT = 1000;
      var requestManager = {
          adserverRequestSent: false,
          aps: false,
          prebid: false
      };
      var slot, requestSlot, interstitialSlot;
      if(adcode.includes("_OOP")) {
        if (adcode.includes("_INSTL_OOP")) {
            googletag.cmd.push(function () {
              slot = googletag.defineOutOfPageSlot(adcode, googletag.enums.OutOfPageFormat.INTERSTITIAL).addService(googletag.pubads());
              interstitialSlot = slot;
            });
          }
          else {
            googletag.cmd.push(function () {
              slot = googletag.defineOutOfPageSlot(adcode, divid).addService(googletag.pubads());
            });
          }
      }
      else{
       if(!adcode.includes("/undefined")) {
        googletag.cmd.push(function () {
          slot = googletag.defineSlot(adcode, adsizes, divid).addService(googletag.pubads());
          googletag.pubads().disableInitialLoad();
        });
        }
      }
      googletag.cmd.push(function () {
          requestSlot = googletag.pubads().getSlots().filter(item => item.getSlotElementId() == divid);
      });

      // when both APS and Prebid have returned, initiate ad request
      function biddersBack() {
          if (requestManager.aps && requestManager.prebid) {
              sendAdserverRequest();
          }
          return;
      }
      
      // sends adserver request
      function sendAdserverRequest() {
        if (requestManager.adserverRequestSent === true) {
          return;
        }
        requestManager.adserverRequestSent = true;
        googletag.cmd.push(function () {
          googletag.pubads().refresh([slot]);
        });
        // auto-close interstitial
            if (adcode.includes("_INSTL_OOP")) {
                googletag.pubads().addEventListener('impressionViewable', (event) => {
                setTimeout(()=>{
                    googletag.destroySlots([interstitialSlot]);
                },15000)
                })
            }
        }
        
      // sends bid request to APS and Prebid
      function requestHeaderBids() {
        //Ignoring NW18 Internal ads for header bidding
        if (adcode.includes("_OOP") || adcode.includes("_1x1") || adcode.includes("NAT")) {
            return sendAdserverRequest();
        }
          // APS request
          apstag.init({
              pubID: '779bdaf2-7955-402f-9476-b0a531d45eaa',
              adServer: 'googletag'
          });
          apstag.fetchBids({
              slots: [{
                slotID: divid,
                slotName: adcode,
                sizes: adsizes
              }]
          }, function (bids) {
              googletag.cmd.push(function () {
                  apstag.setDisplayBids();
                  requestManager.aps = true;
                  biddersBack();
              });
          });                
          googletag.cmd.push(function () {
              if (typeof PWT.requestBids === 'function') {
                  PWT.requestBids(PWT.generateConfForGPT(requestSlot), function (adUnitArray) {
                      PWT.addKeyValuePairsToGPTSlots(adUnitArray);
                      requestManager.prebid = true;
                      biddersBack();
                  });
              } else {
                  requestManager.prebid = true;
                  biddersBack();
              };
          });

      }

      // initiate bid request
      requestHeaderBids();

      // set failsafe timeout
      window.setTimeout(function () {
          sendAdserverRequest();
      }, FAILSAFE_TIMEOUT);

","keywords":"London School of economics, LSE, Satyam Surana, Bias, discrimination","articleSection":["India","World"],"url":"https://www.news18.com/world/indian-student-alleges-biased-probe-on-hate-campaign-at-lse-says-major-campuses-hijacked-by-left-9179860.html","image":["https://images.news18.com/ibnlive/uploads/2025/01/shobhit-17-2025-01-56129f163122524026b1ffb86371642e.png","https://images.news18.com/ibnlive/uploads/2025/01/shobhit-17-2025-01-56129f163122524026b1ffb86371642e-16x9.png"],"datePublished":"2025-01-06T18:24:07+05:30","dateModified":"2025-01-06T18:26:59+05:30","articleBody":"Satyam Surana, an Indian student in the United Kingdom (UK), who had alleged hate campaigns during the student union elections at the London School of Economics (LSE), has accused the institution of “bias” and mishandling his case.\nHe alleged that the institution ignored substantial evidence of hate campaigns against him, labelling the inquiry process as unfair and biased.\nIn an interview to news agency ANI, Surana opened up on his allegations and said that despite his providing “irrefutable evidence” to the authorities, all the charges have been ignored citing the submissions as “insufficient” and the remarks by accused students being put under the category of ‘freedom of expression’.\nDespite presenting screenshots of hate messages, course IDs of accused students, and other evidence, his claims were deemed ‘insufficient.’\n“Immediately after all this incident of harassment, hate, bullying and all the doxing happened, I immediately approached the university’s authorities for the redressal and through every mechanism possible. I approached the security and the department to withhold the security footage right from getting the accused person’s CCTV footage of scribbling and marking my posters over the campus, to reporting the WhatsApp messages, the hate comments that I got, the abuses that I got on different platforms of social media,” he said to the news agency.\nSurana also alleged that the authorities deliberately delayed the investigation to favour the accused students, as most of them ended up passing out in this long duration.\nThe Pune-born Satyam Surana in 2023 came into the spotlight when he defiantly picked up the tricolour from the road during an attack at the Indian High Commission by extremist elements. In a series of social media posts on March 26 last year, Surana said he was targeted for taking a pro-India position on issues like terrorism and Ram mandir, during the LSE student polls.\nSurana further claimed that major university campuses at present have been overtaken by left-leaning ideologies that stifle diverse voices, particularly those of students with Hindu identities.\n“This is not the first incidence of what I have faced there have been multiple similar incidents in the past be it in Oxford, be it in the same London School of Economics, or be it in other universities as well. So this systematic pattern highlights one very important thing these campuses are not open to accepting people who are vocal about their Hindu identity, Indian identity or any sort of identity or ideology which is incoherent with their well-established left-wing ideology,” Surana said.\n“We have faculties who are consistent in their anti-India stance we have a multiple number of other faculties in other universities…Their anti-India hatred stems from theirhinti-Hindu hatred which as a political ideology has now manifested itself in these people’s different forms of urban naxalism, and they are using and they are brainwashing these groups of young Indian students and turning them into what we may call, urban nationals, Maoists terror sympathizers and that is why they have hijacked this entire academia, he added.\nLast year, Surana had alleged that he was targeted and called a ‘fascist’ while campaigning for the student union elections.\nHe had alleged that a campaign was initiated against him hours before the voting for the student union elections began. He also alleged that his opponents associated him with the BJP, and labelled him a ‘fascist’ to boycott him.\nSurana had also claimed those who targeted him were the ones who could not digest the success of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, thus resorting to such false and malicious propaganda.\n(With inputs from ANI)","wordCount":590,"author":[{"@type":"Person","name":"Shobhit Gupta","url":"https://www.news18.com/byline/shobhit-gupta-28018.html"}],"publisher":{"@type":"NewsMediaOrganization","name":"News18","url":"https://www.news18.com","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://images.news18.com/dlxczavtqcctuei/news18/static/images/english/news18-600X60.png","width":600,"height":60}},"associatedMedia":{"@type":"imageObject","url":"https://images.news18.com/ibnlive/uploads/2025/01/shobhit-17-2025-01-56129f163122524026b1ffb86371642e.png","caption":"Satyam Surana (ANI)","description":"Satyam Surana (ANI)","height":900,"width":1200}}</script><script type="application/ld+json"></script><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"item":{"@id":"https://www.news18.com/","name":"News"}},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"item":{"@id":"https://www.news18.com/world/","name":"world"}},{"@type":"ListItem","position":3,"item":{"name":"Indian Student Alleges ‘Biased’ Probe On Hate Campaign At LSE, Says Major Campuses ‘Hijacked’ By Left"}}]}</script><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org/","@type":"WebPage","name":"Indian Student Alleges ‘Biased’ Probe On Hate Campaign At LSE, Says Major Campuses ‘Hijacked’ By Left","description":"Last year, Satyam Surana had alleged that he was targeted and called a 'fascist' while campaigning for the student union elections at London School of Economics (LSE). amimg"><img src="https://images.news18.com/ibnlive/uploads/2025/01/shobhit-17-2025-01-56129f163122524026b1ffb86371642e.png?impolicy=website&width=360&height=270" alt="Satyam Surana (ANI)" title="Satyam Surana (ANI)" data-src="https://images.news18.com/ibnlive/uploads/2021/07/1627283897_news18_logo-1200x800.jpg?impolicy=website&width=360&height=270" loading="eager" class="jsx-7ca078c3173863e4 jsx-602550594"><div class="jsx-7ca078c3173863e4 jsx-602550594 imgcap">Satyam Surana (ANI)</div></figure><p id="0" class="story_para_0">Satyam Surana, an Indian student in the United Kingdom (UK), who had alleged hate campaigns during the student union elections at the London School of Economics (LSE), has accused the institution of “bias" and mishandling his case.</p><p id="1" class="story_para_1">He alleged that the institution ignored substantial evidence of hate campaigns against him, labelling the inquiry process as unfair and biased.</p><div><div class="jsx-249386c32aa3ce09 rltdst"><h2 class="jsx-249386c32aa3ce09 rltdttl">related stories</h2><ul class="jsx-249386c32aa3ce09 rltdlist"></ul></div></div><p id="2" class="story_para_2">In an interview to news agency <em>ANI</em>, Surana <a href="https://www.news18.com/world/indian-student-at-london-school-of-economics-i-supported-pm-modi-8829301.html">opened up on his allegations</a> and said that despite his providing “irrefutable evidence" to the authorities, all the charges have been ignored citing the submissions as “insufficient" and the remarks by accused students being put under the category of ‘freedom of expression’.</p><p id="3" class="story_para_3">Despite presenting screenshots of hate messages, course IDs of accused students, and other evidence, his claims were deemed ‘insufficient.’</p><p id="4" class="story_para_4">“Immediately after all this incident of harassment, hate, bullying and all the doxing happened, I immediately approached the university’s authorities for the redressal and through every mechanism possible. I approached the security and the department to withhold the security footage right from getting the accused person’s CCTV footage of scribbling and marking my posters over the campus, to reporting the WhatsApp messages, the hate comments that I got, the abuses that I got on different platforms of social media," he said to the news agency.</p><div class="desktopad"><div class="lazyload-wrapper ad1"><div style="height:90px" class="lazyload-placeholder"></div></div></div><p id="5" class="story_para_5">Surana also alleged that the authorities deliberately delayed the investigation to favour the accused students, as most of them ended up passing out in this long duration.</p><p id="6" class="story_para_6">The Pune-born Satyam Surana in 2023 <a href="https://www.news18.com/india/conscience-was-shocked-indian-student-entered-pro-khalistan-protest-in-uk-to-pick-up-fallen-flag-watch-8606051.html">came into the spotlight when he defiantly picked up the tricolour from the road</a> during an attack at the Indian High Commission by extremist elements. In a series of social media posts on March 26 last year, Surana said he was targeted for taking a pro-India position on issues like terrorism and Ram mandir, during the LSE student polls.</p><p id="7" class="story_para_7">Surana further claimed that major university campuses at present have been overtaken by left-leaning ideologies that stifle diverse voices, particularly those of students with Hindu identities.</p><p id="8" class="story_para_8">“This is not the first incidence of what I have faced there have been multiple similar incidents in the past be it in Oxford, be it in the same London School of Economics, or be it in other universities as well. So this systematic pattern highlights one very important thing these campuses are not open to accepting people who are vocal about their Hindu identity, Indian identity or any sort of identity or ideology which is incoherent with their well-established left-wing ideology," Surana said.</p><div id="taboola-mid-article-thumbnails"></div><p id="9" class="story_para_9">“We have faculties who are consistent in their anti-India stance we have a multiple number of other faculties in other universities…Their anti-India hatred stems from theirhinti-Hindu hatred which as a political ideology has now manifested itself in these people’s different forms of urban naxalism, and they are using and they are brainwashing these groups of young Indian students and turning them into what we may call, urban nationals, Maoists terror sympathizers and that is why they have hijacked this entire academia, he added.</p><p id="10" class="story_para_10">Last year, Surana had alleged that he was targeted and called a ‘fascist’ while campaigning for the student union elections.</p><p id="11" class="story_para_11">He had alleged that a campaign was initiated against him hours before the voting for the student union elections began. He also alleged that his opponents associated him with the BJP, and labelled him a ‘fascist’ to boycott him.</p><div><div class="jsx-64d0a8eecf8c234f vdcomp_wrap"><div class="jsx-64d0a8eecf8c234f class="story_para_12">Surana had also claimed those who targeted him were the ones who could not digest the success of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, thus resorting to such false and malicious propaganda.</p><p id="13" class="story_para_13"><em>(With inputs from ANI)</em></p><div class="atbtlink tags"><span>tags :</span><div class="rs"><a href="/topics/london-school-of-economics/" He earned his BA Journalism (Hons) degree from Bennett University, Greater Noida.","avtar":"https://images.news18.com/ibnlive/uploads/2024/07/whatsapp-image-2024-07-29-at-09.52.33-2024-07-7ec0e3d79845c4b5c8b9af7985c44bcd.jpeg","author_email":"Shobhit.Gupta@nw18.com","website":"https://www.news18.com/","twitter":"https://x.com/shobhitgupta262 ","facebook":"","instagram":"","youtube":"","linkedin":"","designation":"","author_type":"","author_location":"","status":"","company":""}],"author_id":28018,"author_id_other":0,"blockrobot":false,"body":"\u003cp\u003eSatyam Surana, an Indian student in the United Kingdom (UK), who had alleged hate campaigns during the student union elections at the London School of Economics (LSE), has accused the institution of “bias” and mishandling his case.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHe alleged that the institution ignored substantial evidence of hate campaigns against him, labelling the inquiry process as unfair and biased.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn an interview to news agency \u003cem\u003eANI\u003c/em\u003e, Surana \u003ca href=\"https://www.news18.com/world/indian-student-at-london-school-of-economics-i-supported-pm-modi-8829301.html\"\u003eopened up on his allegations\u003c/a\u003e and said that despite his providing “irrefutable evidence” to the authorities, all the charges have been ignored citing the submissions as “insufficient” and the remarks by accused students being put under the category of ‘freedom of expression’.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDespite presenting screenshots of hate messages, course IDs of accused students, and other evidence, his claims were deemed ‘insufficient.’\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e“Immediately after all this incident of harassment, hate, bullying and all the doxing happened, I immediately approached the university’s authorities for the redressal and through every mechanism possible. I approached the security and the department to withhold the security footage right from getting the accused person’s CCTV footage of scribbling and marking my posters over the campus, to reporting the WhatsApp messages, the hate comments that I got, the abuses that I got on different platforms of social media,” he said to the news agency.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSurana also alleged that the authorities deliberately delayed the investigation to favour the accused students, as most of them ended up passing out in this long duration.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Pune-born Satyam Surana in 2023 \u003ca href=\"https://www.news18.com/india/conscience-was-shocked-indian-student-entered-pro-khalistan-protest-in-uk-to-pick-up-fallen-flag-watch-8606051.html\"\u003ecame into the spotlight when he defiantly picked up the tricolour from the road\u003c/a\u003e during an attack at the Indian High Commission by extremist elements. In a series of social media posts on March 26 last year, Surana said he was targeted for taking a pro-India position on issues like terrorism and Ram mandir, during the LSE student polls.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSurana further claimed that major university campuses at present have been overtaken by left-leaning ideologies that stifle diverse voices, particularly those of students with Hindu identities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e“This is not the first incidence of what I have faced there have been multiple similar incidents in the past be it in Oxford, be it in the same London School of Economics, or be it in other universities as well. So this systematic pattern highlights one very important thing these campuses are not open to accepting people who are vocal about their Hindu identity, Indian identity or any sort of identity or ideology which is incoherent with their well-established left-wing ideology,” Surana said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e“We have faculties who are consistent in their anti-India stance we have a multiple number of other faculties in other universities…Their anti-India hatred stems from theirhinti-Hindu hatred which as a political ideology has now manifested itself in these people’s different forms of urban naxalism, and they are using and they are brainwashing these groups of young Indian students and turning them into what we may call, urban nationals, Maoists terror sympathizers and that is why they have hijacked this entire academia, he added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLast year, Surana had alleged that he was targeted and called a ‘fascist’ while campaigning for the student union elections.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHe had alleged that a campaign was initiated against him hours before the voting for the student union elections began. He also alleged that his opponents associated him with the BJP, and labelled him a ‘fascist’ to boycott him.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSurana had also claimed those who targeted him were the ones who could not digest the success of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, thus resorting to such false and malicious propaganda.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(With inputs from ANI)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","byline":"Shobhit ","keywords":"London School of economics, LSE, Satyam Surana, Bias, discrimination","articleSection":["India","World"],"url":"https://www.news18.com/world/indian-student-alleges-biased-probe-on-hate-campaign-at-lse-says-major-campuses-hijacked-by-left-9179860.html","image":["https://images.news18.com/ibnlive/uploads/2025/01/shobhit-17-2025-01-56129f163122524026b1ffb86371642e.png","https://images.news18.com/ibnlive/uploads/2025/01/shobhit-17-2025-01-56129f163122524026b1ffb86371642e-16x9.png"],"datePublished":"2025-01-06T18:24:07+05:30","dateModified":"2025-01-06T18:26:59+05:30","articleBody":"Satyam Surana, an Indian student in the United Kingdom (UK), who had alleged hate campaigns during the student union elections at the London School of Economics (LSE), has accused the institution of “bias” and mishandling his case.\nHe alleged that the institution ignored substantial evidence of hate campaigns against him, labelling the inquiry process as unfair and biased.\nIn an interview to news agency ANI, Surana opened up on his allegations and said that despite his providing “irrefutable evidence” to the authorities, all the charges have been ignored citing the submissions as “insufficient” and the remarks by accused students being put under the category of ‘freedom of expression’.\nDespite presenting screenshots of hate messages, course IDs of accused students, and other evidence, his claims were deemed ‘insufficient.’\n“Immediately after all this incident of harassment, hate, bullying and all the doxing happened, I immediately approached the university’s authorities for the redressal and through every mechanism possible. I approached the security and the department to withhold the security footage right from getting the accused person’s CCTV footage of scribbling and marking my posters over the campus, to reporting the WhatsApp messages, the hate comments that I got, the abuses that I got on different platforms of social media,” he said to the news agency.\nSurana also alleged that the authorities deliberately delayed the investigation to favour the accused students, as most of them ended up passing out in this long duration.\nThe Pune-born Satyam Surana in 2023 came into the spotlight when he defiantly picked up the tricolour from the road during an attack at the Indian High Commission by extremist elements. In a series of social media posts on March 26 last year, Surana said he was targeted for taking a pro-India position on issues like terrorism and Ram mandir, during the LSE student polls.\nSurana further claimed that major university campuses at present have been overtaken by left-leaning ideologies that stifle diverse voices, particularly those of students with Hindu identities.\n“This is not the first incidence of what I have faced there have been multiple similar incidents in the past be it in Oxford, be it in the same London School of Economics, or be it in other universities as well. So this systematic pattern highlights one very important thing these campuses are not open to accepting people who are vocal about their Hindu identity, Indian identity or any sort of identity or ideology which is incoherent with their well-established left-wing ideology,” Surana said.\n“We have faculties who are consistent in their anti-India stance we have a multiple number of other faculties in other universities…Their anti-India hatred stems from theirhinti-Hindu hatred which as a political ideology has now manifested itself in these people’s different forms of urban naxalism, and they are using and they are brainwashing these groups of young Indian students and turning them into what we may call, urban nationals, Maoists terror sympathizers and that is why they have hijacked this entire academia, he added.\nLast year, Surana had alleged that he was targeted and called a ‘fascist’ while campaigning for the student union elections.\nHe had alleged that a campaign was initiated against him hours before the voting for the student union elections began. He also alleged that his opponents associated him with the BJP, and labelled him a ‘fascist’ to boycott him.\nSurana had also claimed those who targeted him were the ones who could not digest the success of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, thus resorting to such false and malicious propaganda.\n(With inputs from ANI)","wordCount":590,"author":[{"@type":"Person","name":"Shobhit During her time, she’s covered news on the ice storm, Ingraham High School shooting and everyday breaking news.{/p}{p}Karina started her career at KVEO in the Rio Grande Valley in South Texas as a reporter and weekend anchor. She reported on the tragic mass shooting at Robb Elementary School, where 19 students and two teachers were killed in Uvalde, Texas. Other reports included the COVID-19 shutdowns, the impact hospitals were facing and major political visits to the border, including Former President Donald Trump, who traveled there to address immigration.{/p}{p}Karina was born and raised in Southern California and graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Journalism and Communications Studies from California State University, Northridge.{/p}{p}After spending three years in the Texas sun, Karina is excited to be closer to home and enjoying the weather in the PNW. During her time off, you can find her trying out new restaurants, hiking and spending time with friends and title=\"https://komonews.com/news/local/alaska-airlines-flight-1282-returns-to-pdx-after-a-depressurization-just-after-takeoff-boeing-737-max\"}door plug blew off an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 MAX 9 aircraft{/a}, leaving passengers in shock and raising concerns about the safety of Boeing planes. {/p}{p}The flight was en route from Portland, Oregon, to Ontario, California, when the incident occurred.{/p}{p}John Wilson, a traveler, recalled the terrifying moment, saying, \"I was completely shocked and my heart goes out to the people that had to endure that moment of uncertainty with what was going to happen on their flight.\"{/p}{p}In the aftermath, Boeing faced intense scrutiny over its safety and quality standards. Despite this, the company has consistently maintained that its planes are safe to fly. Some travelers, however, remain apprehensive.{/p}{p}\"I heard they fixed the planes so it made me feel a little bit safer but I’m still a bit nervous that something bad could happen,\" said Lauren Waters, another traveler.{/p}{p}{strong}RELATED | {a href=\"https://komonews.com/news/local/boeing-still-needs-culture-change-to-put-safety-above-profits-according-to-faa-chief#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://komonews.com/news/local/boeing-still-needs-culture-change-to-put-safety-above-profits-according-to-faa-chief#\"}Boeing still needs culture change to put safety above profits, according to FAA chief{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has previously grounded various versions of Boeing's 737, 777, and 787 jets due to potential safety and quality issues. In response, Boeing has implemented several improvements, including enhancing its safety and quality culture, investing in workforce training, simplifying processes, and increasing inspections to eliminate defects.{/p}{p}Brian Jones, a traveler, expressed confidence in Boeing's efforts, stating, \"I think it’s very beneficial for the public at large because they’re such a huge company they’re sort of the anchor of our aerospace industry but they’re also major contractor for the military and NASA, so we really need companies like that to be product driven and to be results-oriented.\"{/p}{p}{strong}PHOTOS | {a href=\"https://komonews.com/news/local/gallery/united-airlines-found-loose-bolts-other-issues-on-a-key-part-of-grounded-boeing-737-max-9-jetliners-alaska-airlines-flight-1282-window-blowout-mid-flight-danger-safety-travel-airport-disruption-concerns-discourse-plane-aircraft-repair-inspection?photo=1\" plug recovered from Alaska Airlines flight that fell off mid-flight{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}Despite the incident, some travelers continue to fly with Boeing. \"I feel like it’s probably more safe now that the incident happened unfortunately I don’t really have concerns about safety when I fly now,\" said Wilson.{/p}{p}Others, like Jones, remain cautious, noting, \"Every time I get on the plane, but every time I get in a car there’s safety concerns or when I get on a train there’s safety concerns it’s just about making calculated risks in life.\"{/p}{p}Looking ahead, some travelers are calling for increased oversight from the FAA to ensure the safety of all During her time, she’s covered news on the ice storm, Ingraham High School shooting and everyday breaking news.{/p}{p}Karina started her career at KVEO in the Rio Grande Valley in South Texas as a reporter and weekend anchor. She reported on the tragic mass shooting at Robb Elementary School, where 19 students and two teachers were killed in Uvalde, Texas. Other reports included the COVID-19 shutdowns, the impact hospitals were facing and major political visits to the border, including Former President Donald Trump, who traveled there to address immigration.{/p}{p}Karina was born and raised in Southern California and graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Journalism and Communications Studies from California State University, Northridge.{/p}{p}After spending three years in the Texas sun, Karina is excited to be closer to home and enjoying the weather in the PNW. During her time off, you can find her trying out new restaurants, hiking and spending time with friends and title=\"https://komonews.com/news/local/alaska-airlines-flight-1282-returns-to-pdx-after-a-depressurization-just-after-takeoff-boeing-737-max\"}door plug blew off an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 MAX 9 aircraft{/a}, leaving passengers in shock and raising concerns about the safety of Boeing planes. {/p}{p}The flight was en route from Portland, Oregon, to Ontario, California, when the incident occurred.{/p}{p}John Wilson, a traveler, recalled the terrifying moment, saying, \"I was completely shocked and my heart goes out to the people that had to endure that moment of uncertainty with what was going to happen on their flight.\"{/p}{p}In the aftermath, Boeing faced intense scrutiny over its safety and quality standards. Despite this, the company has consistently maintained that its planes are safe to fly. Some travelers, however, remain apprehensive.{/p}{p}\"I heard they fixed the planes so it made me feel a little bit safer but I’m still a bit nervous that something bad could happen,\" said Lauren Waters, another traveler.{/p}{p}{strong}RELATED | {a href=\"https://komonews.com/news/local/boeing-still-needs-culture-change-to-put-safety-above-profits-according-to-faa-chief#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://komonews.com/news/local/boeing-still-needs-culture-change-to-put-safety-above-profits-according-to-faa-chief#\"}Boeing still needs culture change to put safety above profits, according to FAA chief{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has previously grounded various versions of Boeing's 737, 777, and 787 jets due to potential safety and quality issues. In response, Boeing has implemented several improvements, including enhancing its safety and quality culture, investing in workforce training, simplifying processes, and increasing inspections to eliminate defects.{/p}{p}Brian Jones, a traveler, expressed confidence in Boeing's efforts, stating, \"I think it’s very beneficial for the public at large because they’re such a huge company they’re sort of the anchor of our aerospace industry but they’re also major contractor for the military and NASA, so we really need companies like that to be product driven and to be results-oriented.\"{/p}{p}{strong}PHOTOS | {a href=\"https://komonews.com/news/local/gallery/united-airlines-found-loose-bolts-other-issues-on-a-key-part-of-grounded-boeing-737-max-9-jetliners-alaska-airlines-flight-1282-window-blowout-mid-flight-danger-safety-travel-airport-disruption-concerns-discourse-plane-aircraft-repair-inspection?photo=1\" plug recovered from Alaska Airlines flight that fell off mid-flight{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}Despite the incident, some travelers continue to fly with Boeing. \"I feel like it’s probably more safe now that the incident happened unfortunately I don’t really have concerns about safety when I fly now,\" said Wilson.{/p}{p}Others, like Jones, remain cautious, noting, \"Every time I get on the plane, but every time I get in a car there’s safety concerns or when I get on a train there’s safety concerns it’s just about making calculated risks in life.\"{/p}{p}Looking ahead, some travelers are calling for increased oversight from the FAA to ensure the safety of all body, ::after, ::before {
  box-sizing: border-box;
}

.evg-modal-body::-webkit-scrollbar-track {
  background: inherit;
}

.evg-modal-body::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb {
  background: lightgrey;
  border: 1px solid lightgrey;
  border-radius: 5px;
  width: 15px;
}

.evg-modal-body::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb:hover {
    background: lightgrey;
}

/* ==========================================================================
    Modal
========================================================================== */
.evg-modal {
  position: fixed;
  z-index: 100000;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  overflow-x: hidden;
  overflow-y: auto;
  outline: 0;
}

/* ==========================================================================
    Modal Overlay
========================================================================== */
#evg-exit-intent-popup-email-capture .evg-modal-overlay {
    position: fixed;
    top: 0;
    right: 0;
    bottom: 0;
    left: 0;

class="StoryText-module_storyText__FWhP"><p><span class="dateline">SEATTLE — </span>Sunday, Jan. 5, marks one year since a <a href="https://komonews.com/news/local/alaska-airlines-flight-1282-returns-to-pdx-after-a-depressurization-just-after-takeoff-boeing-737-max" target="_blank" title="https://komonews.com/news/local/alaska-airlines-flight-1282-returns-to-pdx-after-a-depressurization-just-after-takeoff-boeing-737-max" class="themeColorForLinks">door plug blew off an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 MAX 9 aircraft</a>, leaving passengers in shock and raising concerns about the safety of Boeing planes. </p><p>The flight was en route from Portland, Oregon, to Ontario, California, when the incident occurred.</p><p>John Wilson, a traveler, recalled the terrifying moment, saying, "I was completely shocked and my heart goes out to the people that had to endure that moment of uncertainty with what was going to happen on their flight."</p><div id="interstory_first_ddb_0"></div><p>In the aftermath, Boeing faced intense scrutiny over its safety and quality standards. Despite this, the company has consistently maintained that its planes are safe to fly. Some travelers, however, remain apprehensive.</p><p>"I heard they fixed the planes so it made me feel a little bit safer but I’m still a bit nervous that something bad could happen," said Lauren Waters, another traveler.</p><div id="taboola-mid-article-reco-reel-0"></div><p><strong>RELATED | <a href="https://komonews.com/news/local/boeing-still-needs-culture-change-to-put-safety-above-profits-according-to-faa-chief#" target="_blank" title="https://komonews.com/news/local/boeing-still-needs-culture-change-to-put-safety-above-profits-according-to-faa-chief#" class="themeColorForLinks">Boeing still needs culture change to put safety above profits, according to FAA chief</a></strong></p><p>The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has previously grounded various versions of Boeing's 737, 777, and 787 jets due to potential safety and quality issues. In response, Boeing has implemented several improvements, including enhancing its safety and quality culture, investing in workforce training, simplifying processes, and increasing inspections to eliminate defects.</p><p>Brian Jones, a traveler, expressed confidence in Boeing's efforts, stating, "I think it’s very beneficial for the public at large because they’re such a huge company they’re sort of the anchor of our aerospace industry but they’re also major contractor for the military and NASA, so we really need companies like that to be product driven and to be results-oriented."</p><p><strong>PHOTOS | <a href="https://komonews.com/news/local/gallery/united-airlines-found-loose-bolts-other-issues-on-a-key-part-of-grounded-boeing-737-max-9-jetliners-alaska-airlines-flight-1282-window-blowout-mid-flight-danger-safety-travel-airport-disruption-concerns-discourse-plane-aircraft-repair-inspection?photo=1" target="_blank" title="https://komonews.com/news/local/gallery/united-airlines-found-loose-bolts-other-issues-on-a-key-part-of-grounded-boeing-737-max-9-jetliners-alaska-airlines-flight-1282-window-blowout-mid-flight-danger-safety-travel-airport-disruption-concerns-discourse-plane-aircraft-repair-inspection?photo=1" class="themeColorForLinks">Door plug recovered from Alaska Airlines flight that fell off mid-flight</a></strong></p><p>Despite the incident, some travelers continue to fly with Boeing. "I feel like it’s probably more safe now that the incident happened unfortunately I don’t really have concerns about safety when I fly now," said Wilson.</p><p>Others, like Jones, remain cautious, noting, "Every time I get on the plane, but every time I get in a car there’s safety concerns or when I get on a train there’s safety concerns it’s just about making calculated risks in life."</p><div class="CommentCallToAction-module_callToActionContainer__m3Pq" data-testid="comments-call-to-action" id="js-CommentCallToAction-Container"><img alt="Comment bubble" COMMENT</div></div><p>Looking ahead, some travelers are calling for increased oversight from the FAA to ensure the safety of all passengers.</p></div></div></div></div><div Adeno virus pushes Finnish soldiers back to facemasks, isolations-Xinhua

Adeno virus pushes Finnish soldiers back to facemasks, isolations

Source: Xinhua| 2025-01-06 20:38:45|Editor: huaxia

HELSINKI, Jan. 6 (Xinhua) -- With the arrival of 12,000 new conscripts on Monday, facemasks and internal isolations returned to Finnish military barracks.

The intention is to prevent further spreading of the Adeno virus that has plagued the forces during the last year, the official military newspaper Ruotuvaki reported.

Arriving conscripts will be deployed in small cohorts that do not meet people of other cohorts during the first three weeks. The traditional "open houses" at all barracks for friends and family during the first month will be cancelled, the Defence Forces said.

Contrary to the usual profile of the Adeno, many soldiers infected with the virus have often developed serious symptoms this past autumn, the Defence Forces said. Some required intensive care.

Major Saku Silmu, head of training at a brigade in western Finland, told national radio Yle that with the measures, the risk of an uncontrolled spreading of the virus in the barracks is minimized.

The incubation time of the virus could be two weeks, he said. Besides Adeno, there have been cases of COVID-19, Mycoplasma and whooping cough, the Defence Forces said.

Finland is one of the few countries in Western Europe that have maintained a general national service. ■

Joe Tipper completes industry panel at BMF All Industry Conference

6 January, 2025
SHARE
Joe Tipper.

Joe Tipper, Director at Tippers, has been announced as the fourth and final member of an industry panel at the BMF All Industry Conference 2025.

After leaving Warwick Business School, Tipper qualified as a Chartered Accountant with PwC before moving into the family business in 2007. Since that time, he has worked alongside his brother Bill and father Andrew, to develop the business. This growth has been achieved through extending the branch network from six to 16 locations and developing specialist categories such as tool and plant hire, plumbing and heating and volumetric concrete mixing.  

Tipper will be joined on the industry panel by John Carter, of Stark Building Materials, Jennie Daly CBE, of Taylor Wimpey and Neil Jefferson, of the Home Builders Federation.

John Newcomb, BMF CEO said: “This year’s panel brings together leading figures from housebuilding and building materials to discuss the latest trends, challenges and opportunities.

“We are delighted that Joe has agreed to take part and provide an independent merchant’s view.”

<article id="post-266162" class="post-266162 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-georgia-peanut-commission">
  <div class="entry-featured">
    <div class="entry-thumb"><img width="862" height="539" src="https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?fit=862%2C539&ssl=1" class="attachment-entry size-entry wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?w=1867&ssl=1 1867w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=300%2C188&ssl=1 300w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=1024%2C640&ssl=1 1024w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=768%2C480&ssl=1 768w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=1536%2C960&ssl=1 1536w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=100%2C63&ssl=1 100w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=862%2C539&ssl=1 862w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=1200%2C750&ssl=1 1200w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?w=1484&ssl=1 1484w" sizes="(max-width: 862px) 100vw, 862px"></div>  </div>
  <div class="entry-wrap">
    
<header class="entry-header">
    <h1 class="entry-title">Come One Come All: Georgia Peanut Farm Show Slated for Jan. 16</h1>
    <p class="p-meta"><span><i class="x-icon-pencil" data-x-icon-s=""></i> Clint Thompson</span><span><time class="entry-date" datetime="2025-01-06T06:15:00-05:00"><i class="x-icon-calendar" data-x-icon-s=""></i> January 6, 2025</time></span><span><a href="https://southeastagnet.com/category/industry/georgia-peanut-commission/" title="View all posts in: “Georgia Peanut Commission (GPC)”"><i class="x-icon-bookmark" data-x-icon-s=""></i> Georgia Peanut Commission (GPC)</a></span></p></header>    


<div class="entry-content content">


  <div class="mailmunch-forms-before-post" style="display: none !important;"></div>
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?ssl=1"><img data-recalc-dims="1" decoding="async" width="742" height="464" src="https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=742%2C464&ssl=1" alt="" class="wp-image-266163" srcset="https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=1024%2C640&ssl=1 1024w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=300%2C188&ssl=1 300w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=768%2C480&ssl=1 768w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=1536%2C960&ssl=1 1536w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=100%2C63&ssl=1 100w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=862%2C539&ssl=1 862w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?resize=1200%2C750&ssl=1 1200w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?w=1867&ssl=1 1867w, https://i0.wp.com/southeastagnet.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PeanutFarmShow.jpg?w=1484&ssl=1 1484w" sizes="(max-width: 742px) 100vw, 742px"></a></figure>



<p>The Georgia Peanut Commission reminds growers, industry leaders and all those wanting to know more about Georgia peanuts that they are invited to this year’s annual Georgia Peanut Farm Show. It is slated for Thursday, Jan. 16, at the University of Georgia (UGA) Tifton Campus Conference Center in Tifton, Georgia.</p>



<p>The 48<sup>th</sup> annual show and conference will be held from 8 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. The event will provide attendees an opportunity to view products and services of nearly 100 exhibitors and educational programs.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading">Educational Seminars</h4>



<p>UGA specialists will provide pertinent information during the peanut production seminar, scheduled from 9 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. The information will center on the multiple weather events of 2024 and what to expect in 2025; along with management of foliage feeders and soil borne insects, history and management of tropical spiderwort and leafspot disease management.</p>



<p>An Industry Seed Seminar will follow from 10:35 a.m. to 11:35 a.m. It is sponsored by the American Peanut Shellers Association, Georgia Peanut Commission, Southern Peanut Farmers Federation and the U.S. Peanut Federation. Growers will learn about peanut varieties for the upcoming season and beyond.</p>



<p>A free luncheon will be held at noon for all peanut farmers in attendance. The Georgia Peanut Commission will provide a short program at 12:15 p.m. with updates from the National Peanut Board and Washington D.C.</p><div class="mailmunch-forms-in-post-middle" style="display: none !important;"></div>



<p>Kelley Manufacturing Co. is providing the Grand Door Prize of one season’s use of a new peanut combine and $5,000 cash money. Farmers can also register to win the Grower Prize, donated by Amadas Industries. It includes a certificate good for $15,000 towards the purchase of a new Amadas self-propelled peanut combine, or $7,500 towards the purchase of a new four-row or six-row Amadas pull-type combine, or $4,500 towards the purchase of a new Amadas six-row or eight-row peanut digger, or $1,500 towards the purchase of a new Amadas peanut dump cart and a customized Grizzly cooler.</p>



<p>The winners of the Grand Door Prize and the Grower Prize must be certified peanut farmers with an FSA farm number and present to win.</p>



<p>For more information on the show, contact GPC at 229-386-3470 or online at <a href="https://wemm4xbab.cc.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001RE_n1owBabeR1Em2Y3HRZ741QC9zgZBCtzrR-xfl5IQ55VYkJ32iLz5MLpHUxliLGnGuWKBIiSRlDDmW33ayQhgHk2wViftJ5EbkdrtvVGopJB8QsjO6s7b8yT4wundYsWjwzrMZ6ZENtSWxHL7QAAvn6O-cZxCv1oUX29LR4Qo=&c=lWk-9cQuuTrOee-5jy-IxDKCEfmW8n8mB-RaGXosgXLN7ldjWa2Rqw==&ch=rSLewdMfdXCt4K8fln8-w-mo0DjXiYjE9bD7o3rlVN5otNB45_ntNQ==" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">www.gapeanuts.com</a>.</p>



<p><a href="https://gapeanuts.com/">Source: Georgia Peanut Commission</a></p>

( function () {

    var module = 'BlockArticleModule';

        var events = "event70";
        trackSPEvents(events);

    window._sp_ = {

                onMessageChoiceSelect: function (message_type, choice_id, choice_type_id) {
                    console.log('message_type: ', message_type);
                    console.log('choice_id: ', choice_id);
                    console.log('choice_type_id: ', choice_type_id);
                    if ('no' === 'yes') {
                        if (choice_type_id === 12) {
                            trackSPEvents('event83'); //Consent Banner Reject All
                            trackSPEvents('event82'); //Journalism Message Shown
                        }
                        if (choice_type_id === 11) {
                            trackSPEvents('event78');
                        }
                        if (choice_type_id === 9) {
                            trackSPEvents('event77');
                        }
                    } else {
                        // these are the second argument in non-gate
                        if (choice_type_id === 12) {
                            trackSPEvents('event77');
                        }

                        if (choice_type_id === 11) {
                            trackSPEvents('event78');
                        }

                        if (choice_type_id === 13) {
		                    trackSPEvents('event83');
                        }
                    }
                },
                onPrivacyManagerActionStatus: function(message_type, status, actionType) {
                    console.log('message_type: ' + message_type);
                    console.log('status: ' + status);
                    console.log('actionType: ' + actionType);
                    if ('no' === 'yes') {
                        if (actionType === 11) {
                            trackSPEvents('event79'); //Privacy Manager Accept
                        }
                        if (actionType === 9) {
                            trackSPEvents('event68'); //Privacy Manager Redirect
                        }
                        if (actionType === 1) {
                            trackSPEvents('event75'); //Forced tcf String Change
                        }
                    } else {
                    // these are the second argument in non-gate
                        if (actionType === 13) {
                            trackSPEvents('event81'); //Privacy Manager Reject
                        }
                        if (actionType === 11) {
                            trackSPEvents('event79'); //Privacy Manager Accept
                        }
                        if (actionType === 1) {
                            trackSPEvents('event80'); //Privacy Manager Save & Exit
                        }
                    }
                },
                onPMCancel: function (message_type) {
                    console.log('onPMCancel', message_type);
                    trackSPEvents('event84'); //Privacy Manager Back
                },
            }
        }

    //         trackSPEvents('event73');
    //         $.cookie('nqab', 'false', { expires: 365, path: '/' });
    //     }
    // });

    __tcfapi('addEventListener', 2, function (tcData, success) {
        // console.log('DFP: Event Listen:', tcData);
        if (success && tcData.eventStatus === 'useractioncomplete') {
            var csnt = 'none';
            if ($.cookie('_sp_enable_dfp_personalized_ads') === 'true') {
                csnt = 'yes';
            } else if ($.cookie('_sp_enable_dfp_personalized_ads') === 'false') {
                csnt = 'no';
            }
            googletag.cmd.push(function() {
                // console.log('DFP: Cookie check - setting dfpcsnt to ', csnt);
                googletag.pubads().setTargeting('dfpcsnt', csnt);
            });
            // ready to start DFP
            startAdvertising(tcData.listenerId);
            setTcfCookie(tcData.purpose.consents, tcData.purpose.legitimateInterests);
        } else if (success && tcData.eventStatus === 'tcloaded') {
            startAdvertising(tcData.listenerId);
        }
    });

    $(document).on('click', '.gdpr-option-v2', function (e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        sendEvent76 = false;
        var id = $(this).data('v2-id');
        if ($(this).data('is-gate') === 'yes') {
            trackSPEvents('event87');
            _sp_.gdpr.loadPrivacyManagerModal(id);
        } else {
            trackSPEvents('event77');
            _sp_.gdpr.loadPrivacyManagerModal(id);
        }
    });

    function getTcfData() {
        __tcfapi('addEventListener', 2, function(data, success) {
            setTcfCookie(data.purpose.consents, data.purpose.legitimateInterests);
        }, [755]);
    }
    getTcfData();

    function setTcfCookie(data, legitimateInterests) {
        var consents = [];
        $.each(data, function(id, consent)  {
            var c = (consent === true) ? 'yes' : 'no';
            consents.push(c)
        });
        // console.log('DFP: consents length: ', consents.length);
        if (consents.length !== 10) {
            // consents = consents.fill('no', consents.length, 10);
            for (var i = consents.length; i < 10; i++) {
                consents[i] = 'no';
            }
        }
        // console.log('DFP: Found consents to store in cookie:', consents);
        $.cookie('prev-tcf-v2', consents.join(','), {domain: '.dumbartonreporter.co.uk', path: '/', expires: 100});

        var consentEvent4 = 'none';
        if (typeof data[4] !== 'undefined') {
            consentEvent4 = data[4] ? 'true' : 'false';
        }
        $.cookie('_sp_enable_dfp_personalized_ads', consentEvent4, {domain: '.dumbartonreporter.co.uk', path: '/', expires: 100});

        var legitInterest = 'none';
        if (legitimateInterests && typeof legitimateInterests[2] !== 'undefined') {
            legitInterest = legitimateInterests[2] ? 'true' : 'false';
        }

        $.cookie('_sp_legitimate_interests', legitInterest , {domain: '.dumbartonreporter.co.uk', path: '/', expires: 100});
    }

    var sendEvent76 = true;

    function trackSPEvents(events) {
        if (events === 'event76' && !sendEvent76) {
            return;
        } else if (events === 'event76') {
            sendEvent76 = false;
        }

        if (typeof window.s !== 'object') {
            // console.log('DFP: No window.s object found, trying again in 1 second');
            window.setTimeout(function () { trackSPEvents(events)} , 1000);
            return;
        }

        // console.log("ADB: Tracking %s", events);
        // Re-create the Omniture object so the data can be tracked.
        var s = window.s;

        if (events.indexOf('event70') !== -1) {
            // console.log('DFP: Events passed, added evars');
            s.eVar35 = 'enabled';
            s.prop35 = 'enabled';
        }

        s.events = events;
        s.linkTrackEvents = events;
        s.linkTrackVars = "eVar2,eVar3,eVar4,eVar5,eVar6,evar7,evar8,evar9,eVar16,eVar19,eVar26,eVar35,eVar43,prop35";
        s.suppressPageView = true;
        s.tl(true,'o','Ad Block');
    }

    function startAdvertising(id)
    {
        if (typeof window.doNotAdvertise !== 'undefined' && window.doNotAdvertise === true) {
            return;
        }

        // console.log("DFP: Is the page fully loaded?", window.googleReady);
        if (window.googleReady !== true) {
            window.setTimeout(function () {
                // console.log('DFP: Google not fully loaded yet, pausing quarter of a second before trying again');
                startAdvertising(id);
            }, 250);
            return;
        }
        // console.log('DFP: Starting advertisement loading routine');
        if (window.advertisingStart === true) {
            return;
        }
        // console.log('DFP: Running advertisement');
        window.advertisingStart = true;

        var googletag = window.googletag;
        // init google objects and array
        (function() {
            var gads = document.createElement('script');
            gads.async = true;
            gads.type = 'text/javascript';
            gads.src = 'https://securepubads.g.doubleclick.net/tag/js/gpt.js';
            var node = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
            node.parentNode.insertBefore(gads, node);
        })();

        var e = new Event('launch:cmp:choice-made');
        window.dispatchEvent(e);

        // AP code
        fetchAp();

        if (usePrebid) {
            // load prebid script
            // console.log("DFP: loading Newsquest Test script");
            var site = 'desktop';
            var _site = 'desktop';

            // load IAS scripts and set up vars
            (function() {
                var ias = document.createElement('script');
                ias.async = true;
                ias.type = 'text/javascript';
                ias.src = 'https://cdn.adsafeprotected.com/iasPET.1.js';
                var node = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
                node.parentNode.insertBefore(ias, node);
            })();

            (function() {
                var pbs = document.createElement('script');
                pbs.async = true;
                pbs.type = 'text/javascript';
                pbs.src = 'https://micro.rubiconproject.com/prebid/dynamic/11022.js?group=newsquest';
                var node = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
                node.parentNode.insertBefore(pbs, node);
            })();

            // console.log('DFP: Starting header bid code from CMP v2 flow');
            googletag.cmd.push(function () {
                // console.log("DFP: loading header bid code - Google is loaded");
                fetchHeaderBids();
            });
        }

        if (
            window.data_layer.user.advertising_experience !== 'Ad-Free' &&
            window.data_layer.config.disable_outbrain !== 'yes'
        ) {
            (function() {
                var ob = document.createElement('script');
                ob.async = true;
                ob.type = 'text/javascript';
                ob.src = 'https://widgets.outbrain.com/outbrain.js';
                var node = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
                node.parentNode.insertBefore(ob, node);
            })();
        }

        // remove the listener
        if (id !== null) {
            window.__tcfapi('removeEventListener', 2, function (success) { }, id);
        }
    }


})();

}

}]);

tp.push(["addHandler", "showTemplate", function (templateParams) {
    handleOfferShow(templateParams);

    trackLocation();

    if ($(templateParams.containerSelector).length > 0) {
        $(templateParams.containerSelector).addClass('shown');

        if (templateParams.containerSelector === '#po-inline-article-inside') {
            $('#piano-container-inside-article').addClass('shown').removeAttr('style');
        }

        if (!$(templateParams.containerSelector).hasClass('mar-block-ad')) {
            $(templateParams.containerSelector).show();
        }

        if (templateParams.containerSelector === '#po-overlay-articlegate-full-width-scroll-below') {

        if (

        ) {

        if (['#piano_blockmodule_target_d', '#po-inline-blocksystem-target-e'].includes(templateParams.containerSelector)) {

        }

        if (templateParams.containerSelector === '#po-inline-articlewall-partialarticle-closable') {

        }

        if (templateParams.containerSelector === '#po-inline-articlewall-fullarticle-closable') {

        }
    }
}]);
